In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that solves your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        
        current_line *= " $word"
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```
You can use the function like this:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec ut erat non nunc mollis sollicitudin."
println(wrap_string(text))
```
This will output:

```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, 
consectetur adipiscing elit. 
Donec ut erat non nunc 
mollis sollicitudin.
```
In this function, we split the input text into words and check if adding a new word to the current line would exceed `text_width`. If it does, we add the current line to our list of lines and start a new one. We repeat this until all words have been processed. The final line is added after the loop completes.
